lines.text: Mr. Bond, bullets do not kill. It is the finger that pulls the trigger.
Exactly. I am now aiming precisely at your groin. So speak or forever hold your piece.
A duel between titans. My golden gun against your Walther PPK. Each of us with a 50-50 chance.
Six bullets to your one?
I only need one.
I mean sir, who would pay a million dollars to have me killed?
Jealous husbands! Outraged chefs! Humiliated tailors! The list is endless!
I like a girl in a bikini. No concealed weapons.
Miss Anders... I didn't recognize you with your clothes on.

When I was a boy I was brought up in a circus. My only real friend was a huge, magnificent African bull elephant. One day, his handler mistreated him and he went berserk. Bleeding, dying, he came and found me, stood on one leg, his best trick, picked me up and put me on his back. The drunken handler came along and emptied his gun into his eye... I emptied my stage pistol into his!
An eye for an eye.
You see, Mr. Bond, I always thought I loved animals. Then I discovered that I enjoyed killing people even more.
You live well, Scaramanga.

At a million dollars a contract I can afford to, Mr Bond. You work for peanuts, a hearty well done from her Majesty the Queen and a pittance of a pension. Apart from that we are the same. To us, Mr Bond, we are the best.
There's a useful four letter word, and you're full of it.

[Bond is interrogating her for Scaramanga's whereabouts]
I know he has a date at the Bottom's Up club tonight!
How will I recognize him?
Tall, slim and dark.
So is my aunt. Anything distinctive about him?
Yes, but how can I...
[sigh]
He's not like other people. He has three...
[points to her chest]
Oh. Fascinating anatomical tidbit, but probably the most useless piece of information I ever heard. Unless of course the Bottom's Up is a strip club and Scaramanga is performing there.
Ours is the loneliest profession, Mr. Bond.
When I kill, its on the specific orders of my government. And those I kill are themselves killers.
Now, Come, come, Mr. Bond. You disappoint me. You get as much fulfillment out of killing as I do, so why don't you admit it?
I admit killing you would be a pleasure.
Then you should have done that when you first saw me. But then, of course, the English don't consider it sporting to kill in cold blood, do they?
Don't count on that.
Good evening. My name is Bond, James Bond. Your dancing is superb - and so are you.
Merci. And you are very handsome.

[Bond's waiter shows him the wine label]
With the compliments...
PHUYUCK?

[Bond sips some wine]
I approve.

[looking at him incredulously]
You do?
Oh, not the wine, your frock. Tight in all the right places, not too many buttons.
Standard uniform for Southeast Asia. The buttons are down the back.
Designed by Q no doubt. One of them is a suicide pill I suppose?
No, but the bottom one has a homer in it.
How original.
Pistols at dawn; it's a little old-fashioned, isn't it?
That it is. But it remains the only true test for gentlemen.
On that score, I doubt you qualify. However, I accept.

[after Bond has broken out of Hai Fat's karate school]
... What do they teach at that academy? Ballet dancing?

I find nothing amusing in Mr. Bond's escape. May I remind you that you work for me. I took you on to be an occasional consultant, nothing more. I did not pay you to interfere in my affairs. Is that understood? Now, return to the plant and don't leave there without my permission.
[he doesn't see Scaramanga assembling the Golden Gun]
...I now regret having even considered employing your services, but that is beside the point. Bond doesn't know you; he's never seen you. But he knows me. That's the problem.
That's no problem.
[He shoots Fat dead, then disassembles the Golden Gun as one of Fat's aides comes to investigate]
...Mr. Fat has just resigned. I am the new Chairman of the Board.
[goes outside]
...Fat always did like that mausoleum. Put him in it.
[after Scaramanga kills a hired gun brought in by Nick Nack]
This one was the best, n'est-ce pas?
Not bad, not bad at all. But you're going to have to do better if you want to come into my money.
I'll get you yet. And I'll enjoy everything you leave me.
You'll be the death of me yet, Nick Nack.
Ah! I've lost my charm!
Not from where I'm standing.
How do you like my island, Mr Bond?
A bit off the beaten track, isn't it?
I may be small but I never forget!
[first lines]
Nick Nack! Tabasco!
Right away, Monsieur Scaramanga.
Oh look, J.W.! I just got to have me one of those cute little elephants.

[spits]
Elephants! We're Democrats, Maybelle.

My name is Scaramanga. Francisco Scaramanga. I feel I know you, although I never thought we would ever really meet. But it has been a pleasure for me to finally meet you Mr. Bond, thanks to Miss Anders here.
You have a strange way of showing your gratitude.
A mistress cannot serve two masters. She was a difficult shot, but most gratifying.
We all get our jollies one way or another.
Mine has always been guns, Mr. Bond.
[James is sitting in the car]
Goodnight! Where are the car keys?

[from inside Scaramanga's trunk]
Oh, I've got the keys. And I've got the Solex too!
Did you see who shot him?
No, I was in his arms. My eyes were closed.
Well, at least he died happy.
[M stares in shock as Bond relays news of his foul-up]
And that is really all there is to report, sir.
So if I heard correctly, Scaramanga got away - in a car that sprouted wings!
Oh, that's perfectly feasible, sir. As a matter of fact, we're working on one now.
Oh, Q, shut up! Miss Goodnight was in the boot.
Yes, sir. We found the carplane abandonned about two hundred miles west of Bangkok.
And the Solex?
In Goodnight's handbag, sir.

[shakes head]
Where's Miss Goodnight now?
Well, we don't know sir. Communications aren't picking up the signal from the homer she was supplied by Q.

[indignantly]
Rubbish! They're simply not stepping up the reception sufficiently to enable...

[cuts him off]
Oh, shut up! Of all the fouled-up, half-witted operations...

[trying to trace origins of a golden bullet]
Lazar?
Lazar? Hmm, imaginative, highly specialised... Yes! I concur.
Well, what the hell is Lazar?
Not "what", "who". Portuguese. Lives in Macau.
Chap who made the bullet, 007!
He couldn't have missed me tonight. Instead, he hit some chap coming out of the club. I got quite a shock when I saw who it was.
I should think you did.
Our missing solar-energy expert, Gibson.
Yes, Gibson! He was prepared to come back, under special terms. That's why I'm out here with Professor Frazier. I almost wish that Scaramanga had a contract out on you.
Moneypenny - Fairbanks.
Alaska?
No, Bill Fairbanks, 002.

[Sadly]
Oh, poor Bill. I miss him.
Yeah, well the man with the golden gun didn't.
Officially that was never confirmed.
Where was 002 when it happened?
Beirut. '69. In a cabaret with a lady called Saida
Ow! You're hurting my arm!
I'll break it unless you tell me what I want.
the death of 007. Mano a mano. Face to Face. Will me mine.
You mean - stuffed and displayed at your rocky mantelpiece?
It's an amusing idea, but I was thinking in terms of history.
[last lines]

[Getting into bed]
Now, where were we?
[Embrace and Kiss]
Oh, James! Mmmm!
[Bond sees a phone rising up on the nightstand]
What's the matter?
Something came up.
[Bond picks up phone]
Hello?

[Speaking over the phone]
Ah, there you are, Bond. Well done, congratulations.
Thank you, sir.
Is Miss Goodnight with you? I'd like a word with her.
Hold on, sir.
[Bond sets phone down and goes back to kissing Goodnight]
Bond? Bond, are you there? Goodnight?

[Bond picks up the phone]
She's just coming, sir.
[Bond sets phone back down]
Goodnight?

[In the background]
Mmmm.
Goodnight? Goodnight?

[Bond picks up the phone again]
Good night, sir.
[Hangs up the phone]
[Bond returns having dealt with the murderous Nick Nack]
Oh, James. You didn't!
Yes, I damn well did!
This is the part I really like.
[Scaramanga destroys Bond's sea plane with a solar-powered weapon]
Now that's what I call solar power.
That's what I call trouble.
[on the dead Andrea Ankers]

Forget the girl, she's replaceable. Eventually, I shall find what she stole from me. Personally, I've got nothing against you, Mr. Bond, and to keep it that way, let us hope our paths never cross again. Please don't try to follow me.
Your peanut-toting friend back there wouldn't like it?
No, he wouldn't.
Good morning. How's the water?
Why don't you come in and find out?
Sounds very tempting, Miss...?
Chew Mee.
Really? Well, there's only one small problem. I have no swimming trunks.
Neither have I.
[Seeing Andrea Anders dead, Bond begins looking through her purse for the Solex device]
Darling, it must be in your handbag. I saw the man at the shop give it to you.
[Scaramanga appears and sits beside Bond who takes little notice]

[to Scaramanga]
Sorry for what it must look like. Without the ticket, we can't get a recpit for customs.
You woun't find it in there, Mr. Bond. I looked before you came.
[alarmed, Bond is going to draw his gun against Scaramanga]
I wouldn't do that either. Look behind you.
[Bond turns around, but sees no one]
Lower.
[Bond looks down and realizes Nick Nack is behind him with a small pistol and a bag of peanuts in his hands]
A gun in a bag of peanuts, how original. What will they think of next?

[after Bond sticks him into a suitcase]
I'll kill you if you don't let me out of there! Agh! Let me out! You big bully!
Shut up!
[on the solar gun he is about to destroy Bond's seaplane with]

[proudly]
This is a bonus. Goes with the solex, no extra charge!
[Goodnight, a prisoner on Scaramanga's island, appears in a bikini]
Ah, here's Miss Goodnight now.
James!
Aren't we a little overdressed, Goodnight?

[he's just shot a wax replica of Al Capone]
Hey, Al. Al, wherever you are, don't hold it against me!

[at lunch]
Let us see what Nick Nack has for us. Ahh, mushrooms!

[sharply, to Bond]
The fried mushroom looks terribly interesting.
Yes, I had noticed that. I'll get around to it later.

[kissing Bond]
I've dreamed about you setting me free...
I've, uh, been dreaming about a Solex agitator. Ever heard of one?
Your steam bath is ready, Monsieur Scaramanga.
What do you know about a man called Scaramanga, 007?
one million dollars a hit. No photograph on file. But, he does have one distinguishing feature, however, a superfluous papilla.
A what?
A mammary gland. A third nipple, sir. He uses a golden bullet, hence man with the golden gun. Present domicile - unknown.
I'm relieving you of your present assignment, 007.
Sir, the energy crisis is still with us. I respectfully submit that finding Gibson and his solar cell data is even more important than ever.
It is in deed. And I can't jeopardize it... by having Scaramanga pop up and put a bullet in you.
Moneypenny, you are better than a computer.
In all sorts of ways! But, you never take advantage of them.
Let us forget the past.
Oh, I was hoping you would say that.
Are you staying long in Beirut?
It depends.
[Kiss]

[On his knees, kissing belly dancer Saida's belly]
You really do have a - magnificent abdomen.
Do you work for him?
I don't work for him. I'm his - eh, I'm his...
So, he's a lover too.
Only before he kills.
Bullfighters do the same thing. They claim it improves the eye. His eyes are on me. Where can I find him?
Let's drink to that. Bottom's up!
Q, I'll need this.
[Writes something down on a piece of paper and hands it to Q]
Really, 007!
Oh, I admit it's a little kinky.
Don't tell me you saw him?
He even invited me to dinner! He must have found me quite titillating.
[Reaches in his shirt and throws away his fake nipple]
Please hurry back.
I'll ring as soon as I do. A midnight snack might be just the thing.
I'll keep the wine properly chilled.
And everything else warm, I trust.

[after being splashed by speed boats chasing Bond]
God damn little brown water hog!
Oh, what's the matter, J.W.? Hon?
You just try that in my bayou, boy! I'd haul your ass!

[Toast to Goodnight]
To this moment - and the moment yet to come.
[They clink their champagne glasses]
Our profession, I'm afraid, you - never can count on that moment to come. Who knows where you and I will be this time next year?
If Hip doesn't come up with a lead, there's really nothing very much for us to do tonight - - - or, is there?
Oh, darling, I'm tempted. But, killing a few hours as one of your passing fancies, isn't quite my scene.
Goodnight, what a pleasant surprise.
My hard to get act didn't last very long, did it?
I'm trained to expect the unexpected; but, I never prepared for anything like you in the night.
[Shows her his bed]

[In bed]
James, I thought this would never happen.
What made you change your mind?
I'm weak.
I've come to warn you. You're in great danger.
I usually am.
He's a monster. I hate him.
Then leave him.
You don't walk out on Scaramanga. There's no place he wouldn't find me.
You need a good lawyer.
I need 007.
I want him dead. Name your price. Anything. I'll pay it. You can have me too, if you like. I'm not unattractive.
At last, you're starting to tell the truth.
I have to get back to help James.
Something's gone wrong?
There's a midget with gun on him!
A midget?
Same one I saw outside the Bottoms Up. And the girl is dead. Call the Police!

[Talking on a walkie-talkie]
Goodnight, where are you?
Somebody locked me in a boot.
In a what?
The midget's car. I'm locked in!

You can't do this to me! And I want my wallet back. Take these god damn bracelets off! I'm gonna sue you for false arrest. Police brutality! I've got connections. I'm gonna get the FBI on you! And the CIA! God Damn it! I'm gonna get Henry Kissenger! Now, look at me when I'm talkin' to you, boy.
Bon jour, Mr. Bond. I am Nick-nack. Dom Perignon - soixante quatre.
I prefer the '62 myself.
Monsieur, what'd you think?
I've never killed a midget before. But, there can always be a first time.
Oh, monsieur.
James! James!
Steady, Goodnight.
Where is he?
Flat on his coup de grâce. Come on, let's get out of this fun palace and find that solex.
You wait here. I'll take care of the maintenance man.
I already did. I laid him out cold!
You did?
Yes!
There's more to you than meets the eye, Goodnight.
Goodnight, are you still there? It'll be on the auxiliary feedback circuit.
Computer interlock? Is that it?
Just push every damn button will you!

[Aboard a Chinese Junk]
But, darling, who's at the wheel?
George.
George?
Automatic pilot. We should make Hong Kong in about - eight hours - give or take a little.

[Bond approaches Goodnight laying naked in a bed]
I always wanted to take a slow boat *from* China.

[Bond has jumped into a car that Sheriff Pepper was checking inside a dealership. He drives through the dealership window & takes off in pursuit of Scaramanga & Nick Nack, who kidnapped Mary Goodnight and are holding her in the trunk of their car]

[caught off guard as Bond turns the car around]
What the *hell* is going on?
[Bond starts a wild pursuit of Scaramanga & Nick Nack]
Now! I *know* you!
[points at Bond. Bond glances up & recognizes Pepper]
Oh, no!
You're that Secret Agent! That English secret agent! From England!
You're chasin' somebody. Who you got this time, boy? Commies? Let's go get 'em! I'm with you all the way!
[Bond & Pepper continue chasing Scaramanga through Bangkok traffic]

[to Elephant]
Get your cotton-picking schnoz out of my pants, y'know!
What's goin' on with you? What the hell you doin' now, boy? The bridge is that way!
[Sheriff Pepper sees Bond is about to drive over a wrecked bridge]
You're not gonna...

[mimicking Pepper's Southern accent]
I sure am, boy! Ever hear of Evel Knievel?
